node.title: DJ Lowtempo
node.content: [vc_row iron_row_type="in_container" iron_remove_padding_medium="" iron_remove_padding_small="" iron_overlay_pattern="" iron_parallax="" iron_bg_video=""][vc_column][vc_tta_tabs style="flat" shape="square" color="black" active_section="1" no_fill_content_area="true"][vc_tta_section title="Albums" tab_id="1487737705226-144de8d1-04cd"][iron_audioplayer albums="646" autoplay="0" show_playlist="1" show_album_market="1"][iron_audioplayer albums="644" autoplay="0" show_playlist="1" show_album_market="1"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Biography" tab_id="1487737663838-886b7f01-3bb2"][vc_column_text]At the age of 13, Jašarević started producing hip-hop music using an early PC. He later began sharing his tracks through the online music store Beatport, which helped him gain a following in the United States and Europe. Beatport is what Jašarević cites as his gateway to emerging as an electronic artist and landing his first US agent, Hunter Williams.[1] After Jašarević signed with his new agency, he moved to New York City and released his debut studio album Expedition 44 in July 2008,[3] as well as his second studio album Street Bangerz Vol. 1 in December 2008.[4] SB1 charted on Beatport's Top 100 Chill Out chart for six months. In an interview with Britt Chester, Jašarević said, "I didn't even expect the album to sell one track on Beatport, nothing else was sold on beatport except techno and house. When I dropped my album and it started selling, I was really surprised, since I'd never seen a hip-hop album sell on Beatport. So when it sold, I was like 'Wow!' These were hip-hop beats, but it was labeled 'Chill Out' on Beatport. People saw it and thought it was awesome good chill out music, which is fine for me. I didn't expect it at all, and I didn't expect someone to reach out to me as a booking agent."[2] A year after releasing his first album, Jašarević signed to the Pretty Lights Music label as its first new artist, which at the time consisted of only the electronic music producer Pretty Lights (Derek Vincent Smith).[2] The label utilizes a fee-free music model, and Jašarević has stated his belief is that it is "morally right for music to be primarily free", and has been vocal about his history with digital piracy and how it has benefited his career in multiple ways.[5] Jašarević cited his third extended play (EP) #digitalfreedom as having a theme involving "the fight against severe internet censorship bills" such as ACTA, SOPA and PIPA.[1] In 2013, Jašarević announced his departure from the Pretty Lights Music label in order to form his own vanity record label named Lowtemp Recordings. The label's name is an abbreviation of "low temperature", which Jašarević has explained is meant to indicate that music from his label would be "cool", stating, "So from now on, if you think a song of mine is cool, you gotta say that shit's [from] Lowtemp."[6] Lowtemp now consists of artists Exmag (a side project of Gramatik),[7] ILLUMNTR, Gibbz, BRANX, and Russ Liquid. In 2014, Jašarević reissued his first seven albums—including the Street Bangerz series, renamed as SB—on the Lowtemp label with new or updated artwork.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Upcoming Events" tab_id="1487737663808-f6501f16-2140"][iron_events filter="upcoming" events_for="yes" artists_filter="855" enable_artists_filter=""][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Videos" tab_id="1487737697806-3147d172-2cea"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/133697756" css=".vc_custom_1487738992993{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/127401564" css=".vc_custom_1487738998337{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="SoundCloud" tab_id="1487780888277-f0f9a051-be7d"][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row]
node.description: LowTempo is a Finnish-Canadian from Barrie–a working class town in rural Ontario. But his chosen epithet is fitting. Since 2009 he’s been making music under the name LowTempo – writing songs about sunsets, love affairs, and making out with crooked smiles. Through simple arrangements, he charts an escape route from the snow belt to the coral reefs. His new album, Low Grinder, will be released August 19, 2018 on SoundRise Records.

node.title: DJ Eklypse

When I dropped my album and it started selling, I was really surprised, since I'd never seen a hip-hop album sell on Beatport. So when it sold, I was like 'Wow!' These were hip-hop beats, but it was labeled 'Chill Out' on Beatport. People saw it and thought it was awesome good chill out music, which is fine for me. The label's name is an abbreviation of "low temperature", which Jašarević has explained is meant to indicate that music from his label would be "cool", stating, "So from now on, if you think a song of mine is cool, you gotta say that shit's [from] Lowtemp."[6] Lowtemp now consists of artists Exmag (a side project of Gramatik),[7] ILLUMNTR, Gibbz, BRANX, and Russ Liquid. In 2014, Jašarević reissued his first seven albums—including the Street Bangerz series, renamed as SB—on the Lowtemp label with new or updated artwork.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Upcoming Events" tab_id="1487737663808-f6501f16-2140"][iron_events filter="upcoming" events_for="yes" artists_filter="915" enable_artists_filter=""][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Videos" tab_id="1487737697806-3147d172-2cea"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/133697756" css=".vc_custom_1487738992993{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/127401564" css=".vc_custom_1487738998337{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="SoundCloud" tab_id="1487780888277-f0f9a051-be7d"][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row]
node.description: DJ Eklypse is a Canadian indie rock band based in Montreal, Quebec. The band members are: Devon Shwartz on vocals, guitar and percussion; Conner McDavid on vocals, guitar and keyboard; Dylan Dylan on vocals, drums and keyboard; and Isaac Mohamed on vocals, percussions, mandolin, keyboard and guitar. The group is known for their heavy use of percussion, and for playing multiple instruments during live performances.

node.title: Bahamas

node.pagebannersubtitle: Powerful you have become, the dark side I sense in you.
node.description: BAHAMAS's mainstream success was signified by a growing interest in punk rock during the 1990s, but unlike many of their contemporaries (including Bad Religion, Green Day and The Offspring), they have never been signed to a major label. NOFX has released thirteen studio albums, sixteen extended plays<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference">[6]</sup> and a number of seven-inch singles.

node.title: Half Sun Run

node.title: The Voice

node.title: Abel Sheram

When I dropped my album and it started selling, I was really surprised, since I'd never seen a hip-hop album sell on Beatport. So when it sold, I was like 'Wow!' These were hip-hop beats, but it was labeled 'Chill Out' on Beatport. People saw it and thought it was awesome good chill out music, which is fine for me. I didn't expect it at all, and I didn't expect someone to reach out to me as a booking agent."[2] A year after releasing his first album, Jašarević signed to the Pretty Lights Music label as its first new artist, which at the time consisted of only the electronic music producer Pretty Lights (Derek Vincent Smith).[2] The label utilizes a fee-free music model, and Jašarević has stated his belief is that it is "morally right for music to be primarily free", and has been vocal about his history with digital piracy and how it has benefited his career in multiple ways.[5] Jašarević cited his third extended play (EP) #digitalfreedom as having a theme involving "the fight against severe internet censorship bills" such as ACTA, SOPA and PIPA.[1] In 2013, Jašarević announced his departure from the Pretty Lights Music label in order to form his own vanity record label named Lowtemp Recordings. The label's name is an abbreviation of "low temperature", which Jašarević has explained is meant to indicate that music from his label would be "cool", stating, "So from now on, if you think a song of mine is cool, you gotta say that shit's [from] Lowtemp."[6] Lowtemp now consists of artists Exmag (a side project of Gramatik),[7] ILLUMNTR, Gibbz, BRANX, and Russ Liquid. In 2014, Jašarević reissued his first seven albums—including the Street Bangerz series, renamed as SB—on the Lowtemp label with new or updated artwork.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Upcoming Events" tab_id="1487737663808-f6501f16-2140"][iron_events filter="upcoming" events_for="yes" artists_filter="923" enable_artists_filter=""][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Videos" tab_id="1487737697806-3147d172-2cea"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/133697756" css=".vc_custom_1487738992993{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/127401564" css=".vc_custom_1487738998337{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="SoundCloud" tab_id="1487780888277-f0f9a051-be7d"][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row]
node.pagebannersubtitle: Grammy Award for "Best New Artist" in 2017
node.description: BAHAMAS's mainstream success was signified by a growing interest in punk rock during the 1990s, but unlike many of their contemporaries (including Bad Religion, Green Day and The Offspring), they have never been signed to a major label. NOFX has released thirteen studio albums, sixteen extended plays<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference">[6]</sup> and a number of seven-inch singles.

node.title: Thomas Günter

He later began sharing his tracks through the online music store Beatport, which helped him gain a following in the United States and Europe. Beatport is what Jašarević cites as his gateway to emerging as an electronic artist and landing his first US agent, Hunter Williams.[1] After Jašarević signed with his new agency, he moved to New York City and released his debut studio album Expedition 44 in July 2008,[3] as well as his second studio album Street Bangerz Vol. 1 in December 2008.[4] SB1 charted on Beatport's Top 100 Chill Out chart for six months. In an interview with Britt Chester, Jašarević said, "I didn't even expect the album to sell one track on Beatport, nothing else was sold on beatport except techno and house. When I dropped my album and it started selling, I was really surprised, since I'd never seen a hip-hop album sell on Beatport. So when it sold, I was like 'Wow!' These were hip-hop beats, but it was labeled 'Chill Out' on Beatport. People saw it and thought it was awesome good chill out music, which is fine for me. I didn't expect it at all, and I didn't expect someone to reach out to me as a booking agent."[2] A year after releasing his first album, Jašarević signed to the Pretty Lights Music label as its first new artist, which at the time consisted of only the electronic music producer Pretty Lights (Derek Vincent Smith).[2] The label utilizes a fee-free music model, and Jašarević has stated his belief is that it is "morally right for music to be primarily free", and has been vocal about his history with digital piracy and how it has benefited his career in multiple ways.[5] Jašarević cited his third extended play (EP) #digitalfreedom as having a theme involving "the fight against severe internet censorship bills" such as ACTA, SOPA and PIPA.[1] In 2013, Jašarević announced his departure from the Pretty Lights Music label in order to form his own vanity record label named Lowtemp Recordings. The label's name is an abbreviation of "low temperature", which Jašarević has explained is meant to indicate that music from his label would be "cool", stating, "So from now on, if you think a song of mine is cool, you gotta say that shit's [from] Lowtemp."[6] Lowtemp now consists of artists Exmag (a side project of Gramatik),[7] ILLUMNTR, Gibbz, BRANX, and Russ Liquid. In 2014, Jašarević reissued his first seven albums—including the Street Bangerz series, renamed as SB—on the Lowtemp label with new or updated artwork.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Upcoming Events" tab_id="1487737663808-f6501f16-2140"][iron_events filter="upcoming" events_for="yes" artists_filter="855" enable_artists_filter=""][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Videos" tab_id="1487737697806-3147d172-2cea"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/133697756" css=".vc_custom_1487738992993{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/127401564" css=".vc_custom_1487738998337{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="SoundCloud" tab_id="1487780888277-f0f9a051-be7d"][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row]
node.pagebannersubtitle: Where the road ends, my music begins !
node.description: LowTempo1 is a Finnish-Canadian from Barrie–a working class town in rural Ontario. But his chosen epithet is fitting. Since 2009 he’s been making music under the name LowTempo – writing songs about sunsets, love affairs, and making out with crooked smiles. Through simple arrangements, he charts an escape route from the snow belt to the coral reefs. His new album, Low Grinder, will be released August 19, 2018 on SoundRise Records.

node.pagebannersubtitle: Aspire to inspire before we expire.
node.description: DJ Eklypse is a Canadian indie rock band based in Montreal, Quebec. The band members are: Devon Shwartz on vocals, guitar and percussion; Conner McDavid on vocals, guitar and keyboard; Dylan Dylan on vocals, drums and keyboard; and Isaac Mohamed on vocals, percussions, mandolin, keyboard and guitar. The group is known for their heavy use of percussion, and for playing multiple instruments during live performances.

node.title: DJ Capital
node.content:
[vc_row iron_row_type="in_container" iron_remove_padding_medium="" iron_remove_padding_small="" iron_overlay_pattern="" iron_parallax="" iron_bg_video="" css=".vc_custom_1491499072382{padding-top: 60px !important;padding-right: 60px !important;padding-bottom: 60px !important;padding-left: 60px !important;background-color: #000000 !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1491496867338{margin-bottom: 100px !important;}" el_class=".whiteblock"]

DJ CAPITAL UNVEILS A NEW SINGLE

NYNJII – A travel in a world where colors make noise! After his first single “Shore” featuring Milk & Bone, Hoodies at Night returns with his new single “NYNJII”, released on March 2nd via Maisonnette. “NYNJII” is currently the theme for music TV show PLAY hosted by Nicolas Ouellet on Vrak TV.[/vc_column_text][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/133697756" css=".vc_custom_1491496833190{margin-top: 100px !important;margin-bottom: 100px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

When I dropped my album and it started selling, I was really surprised, since I'd never seen a hip-hop album sell on Beatport. So when it sold, I was like 'Wow!' These were hip-hop beats, but it was labeled 'Chill Out' on Beatport. People saw it and thought it was awesome good chill out music, which is fine for me. I didn't expect it at all, and I didn't expect someone to reach out to me as a booking agent."[2] A year after releasing his first album, Jašarević signed to the Pretty Lights Music label as its first new artist, which at the time consisted of only the electronic music producer Pretty Lights (Derek Vincent Smith).[2] The label utilizes a fee-free music model, and Jašarević has stated his belief is that it is "morally right for music to be primarily free", and has been vocal about his history with digital piracy and how it has benefited his career in multiple ways.[5] Jašarević cited his third extended play (EP) #digitalfreedom as having a theme involving "the fight against severe internet censorship bills" such as ACTA, SOPA and PIPA.[1] In 2013, Jašarević announced his departure from the Pretty Lights Music label in order to form his own vanity record label named Lowtemp Recordings. The label's name is an abbreviation of "low temperature", which Jašarević has explained is meant to indicate that music from his label would be "cool", stating, "So from now on, if you think a song of mine is cool, you gotta say that shit's [from] Lowtemp."[6] Lowtemp now consists of artists Exmag (a side project of Gramatik),[7] ILLUMNTR, Gibbz, BRANX, and Russ Liquid. In 2014, Jašarević reissued his first seven albums—including the Street Bangerz series, renamed as SB—on the Lowtemp label with new or updated artwork.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Upcoming Events" tab_id="1487737663808-f6501f16-2140"][iron_events filter="upcoming" events_for="yes" artists_filter="931" enable_artists_filter=""][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Videos" tab_id="1487737697806-3147d172-2cea"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/133697756" css=".vc_custom_1487738992993{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/127401564" css=".vc_custom_1487738998337{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="SoundCloud" tab_id="1487780888277-f0f9a051-be7d"][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row]
node.description: DJ Eklypse is a Canadian indie rock band based in Montreal, Quebec. The band members are: Devon Shwartz on vocals, guitar and percussion; Conner McDavid on vocals, guitar and keyboard; Dylan Dylan on vocals, drums and keyboard; and Isaac Mohamed on vocals, percussions, mandolin, keyboard and guitar. The group is known for their heavy use of percussion, and for playing multiple instruments during live performances.

node.title: Scott Penny
node.content: [vc_row iron_row_type="in_container" iron_remove_padding_medium="" iron_remove_padding_small="" iron_overlay_pattern="" iron_parallax="" iron_bg_video=""][vc_column][vc_tta_tabs style="flat" shape="square" color="black" active_section="1" no_fill_content_area="true"][vc_tta_section title="Albums" tab_id="1487737705226-144de8d1-04cd"][iron_audioplayer albums="646" autoplay="0" show_playlist="1" show_album_market="1"][iron_audioplayer albums="644" autoplay="0" show_playlist="1" show_album_market="1"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Biography" tab_id="1487737663838-886b7f01-3bb2"][vc_column_text]At the age of 13, Jašarević started producing hip-hop music using an early PC. He later began sharing his tracks through the online music store Beatport, which helped him gain a following in the United States and Europe. Beatport is what Jašarević cites as his gateway to emerging as an electronic artist and landing his first US agent, Hunter Williams.[1] After Jašarević signed with his new agency, he moved to New York City and released his debut studio album Expedition 44 in July 2008,[3] as well as his second studio album Street Bangerz Vol. 1 in December 2008.[4] SB1 charted on Beatport's Top 100 Chill Out chart for six months. In an interview with Britt Chester, Jašarević said, "I didn't even expect the album to sell one track on Beatport, nothing else was sold on beatport except techno and house. When I dropped my album and it started selling, I was really surprised, since I'd never seen a hip-hop album sell on Beatport. So when it sold, I was like 'Wow!' These were hip-hop beats, but it was labeled 'Chill Out' on Beatport. People saw it and thought it was awesome good chill out music, which is fine for me. I didn't expect it at all, and I didn't expect someone to reach out to me as a booking agent."[2] A year after releasing his first album, Jašarević signed to the Pretty Lights Music label as its first new artist, which at the time consisted of only the electronic music producer Pretty Lights (Derek Vincent Smith).[2] The label utilizes a fee-free music model, and Jašarević has stated his belief is that it is "morally right for music to be primarily free", and has been vocal about his history with digital piracy and how it has benefited his career in multiple ways.[5] Jašarević cited his third extended play (EP) #digitalfreedom as having a theme involving "the fight against severe internet censorship bills" such as ACTA, SOPA and PIPA.[1] In 2013, Jašarević announced his departure from the Pretty Lights Music label in order to form his own vanity record label named Lowtemp Recordings. The label's name is an abbreviation of "low temperature", which Jašarević has explained is meant to indicate that music from his label would be "cool", stating, "So from now on, if you think a song of mine is cool, you gotta say that shit's [from] Lowtemp."[6] Lowtemp now consists of artists Exmag (a side project of Gramatik),[7] ILLUMNTR, Gibbz, BRANX, and Russ Liquid. In 2014, Jašarević reissued his first seven albums—including the Street Bangerz series, renamed as SB—on the Lowtemp label with new or updated artwork.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Upcoming Events" tab_id="1487737663808-f6501f16-2140"][iron_events filter="upcoming" events_for="yes" artists_filter="855" enable_artists_filter=""][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Videos" tab_id="1487737697806-3147d172-2cea"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/133697756" css=".vc_custom_1487738992993{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/127401564" css=".vc_custom_1487738998337{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="SoundCloud" tab_id="1487780888277-f0f9a051-be7d"][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row]
node.description: LowTempo is a Finnish-Canadian from Barrie–a working class town in rural Ontario. But his chosen epithet is fitting. Since 2009 he’s been making music under the name LowTempo – writing songs about sunsets, love affairs, and making out with crooked smiles. Through simple arrangements, he charts an escape route from the snow belt to the coral reefs. His new album, Low Grinder, will be released August 19, 2018 on SoundRise Records.

node.title: Guns and Plants

node.pagebannersubtitle: Indie Rock and Pop Cheddar Taste Good
node.description: DJ Eklypse is a Canadian indie rock band based in Montreal, Quebec. The band members are: Devon Shwartz on vocals, guitar and percussion; Conner McDavid on vocals, guitar and keyboard; Dylan Dylan on vocals, drums and keyboard; and Isaac Mohamed on vocals, percussions, mandolin, keyboard and guitar. The group is known for their heavy use of percussion, and for playing multiple instruments during live performances.
